I am a full-time consultant and advisor to ambitious CEOs of growing companies. I work directly with founders, CEOs and business owners to overcome their biggest growth challenges. Most of my clients run businesses with revenues between $1 million and $10 million. Some run bigger or smaller businesses, but all these entrepreneurs are serious about creating big impact in the world.I understand what it's like to have a big vision and get stuck on the journey to achieving your growth goals. In these transitional growth phases, adding more tactics, more investment, more people, more intensity doesn't produce more results. Something deeper and more strategic is holding your business back. Behind the countless tactical challenges you face every day are the bigger, strategic questions that need to be solved for your business to keep growing. These aren’t the questions you can answer on the fly or delegate to your marketing department. Answering these foundational questions with clarity and confidence is worth millions to your business – in future revenues, higher company valuation, saved time and mistakes avoided.These challenges are figure-outable. They are just hard to tackle by yourself while you are running a  business. That's where I can help.Contact me directly and we'll have an open conversation about your challenges and if I'm a good fit to help you. Serious inquiries only.http://greghead.com/strategyI also speak nationally to groups of entrepreneurs and business owners, mentor Phoenix software entrepreneurs and I am working on my first book that I will launch later next year.

Since 1992, Invest Southwest has been Arizona's leading organization for facilitating the connection between active investors and our region's most promising early-stage ventures. Invest Southwest's annual "Venture Madness" conference, presented in partnership with the Arizona Commerce Authority, pits 64 of the most promising startups against one another in a bracket-style, head-to-head competition.  http://venturemadness.investsouthwest.org/

For almost five years, I led the marketing team at Infusionsoft, including demand generation, communications, creative, product marketing, small business education, customer marketing and partner programs.Infusionsoft delivers the software, the know-how and the ecosystem of partners to help small business owners get more customers, grow sales and save time. Infusionsoft software combines CRM (customer relationship management), marketing (email and website integration) and ecommerce (shopping cart and orders) in one sales and marketing system with powerful automation to help modern small businesses grow.Growth milestones while I was at Infusionsoft:- Customer growth from 3000 to 30,000 in 100 countries- Employee growth from 130 to 700 Infusionites- Revenue growth from $15m to $100m- ICON conference growth from 700 to 3500 attendees- Partner growth to over 1,000 partners proving services, add-on apps and consulting- Awarded #15 Great Place to Work and #1 software company in Phoenix- Infusionsoft became a leading brand in small business software- Built a world-class marketing team - Raised $100M from Goldman Sachs and Bain Capital- Became the most recognized software company in ArizonaIt has been an honor to be part of several exciting phases of growth at Infusionsoft and to accomplish world-changing contribution with so many passionate and talented people. Infusionsoft truly is a special and powerful product and the company is a true innovator in culture and leadership development.

Intensive consulting with CEO/owners of ten emerging software and technology services companies. Helped create and execute successful marketing strategies for their businesses that helped them transition from startups to fast growth companies. Three of these companies subsequently raised venture capital to fund their rapid growth.

Flypaper is an easy rich media authoring tool that enables non-technical marketing, training and business professionals to create interactive content without the costs of custom Flash development. Flypaper grew steadily from startup in 2006 and was acquired by Trivantis in 2011.

Head of Partnerships at Zapier
February 9, 2016, Cody worked with Greg in different groups

Greg is a dynamic leader, able to create and share the big picture, but OCD enough to get into the mud of the weeds on the details with any of his team members. Greg brought a lot of experience to Infusionsoft, specifically the rigor and importance of having cohesive planning across the organization. Greg helped transform Infusionsoft from a startup to a world-class company, and the best part is that this isn't his first rodeo, but another notch in the long belt of his highly successful career. While Greg is extremely talented, his best quality is that he is a genuine, down-to-earth individual that finds an opportunity to learn from anyone (and I mean anyone) around him. I cannot recommend Greg and his talent highly enough.

Greg is a phenomenal person. He is positive, optimistic, and upbeat by nature. He cares deeply about his people and challenges them to be the very best version of themselves. Although he is very down to earth and personable, he powerfully challenges the status quo, helps people grow and develop their capabilities, and is passionately focused on delivering desired business results. He successfully walks the line between balancing short and long-term needs. He is above all a devoted friend, advocate, and leader who will powerfully impact and improve anything he is a part of.

I worked for Greg nearly 10 years and cannot speak highly enough of him as both a visionary, strategist and for just plain getting things done.   In all my marketing years in the high-tech industry, not only did I learn immensely under his stewardship, but also had a great time doing it.   It's not often that you see a start-up firm grow from a couple of people into a thriving business employing hundreds with products that became mainstream in just 2 short years.   Brilliant mind.  High Energy.   Enthusiasm that never stops.   A total go-getter that inspires all around him to drive toward single goal and vision.  The best ever boss anyone could ask for!

summary: I help founders and CEOs develop stronger growth strategies for their businesses.I have helped three software companies grow from startup to global scale in more than 25 years in the software industry. Most recently, I helped Infusionsoft grow from $15 million to $100 million in revenues in five years as Chief Marketing Officer, leading the company's marketing strategy, demand generation, communications, partner marketing and product marketing functions. I have a track record of success in creating winning products, brands and businesses. I held leadership positions at the startup through acquisition stages of two other highly-successful CRM software businesses, ACT! and SalesLogix, which have generated more than $1 billion in total revenue. - 25+ years building software businesses and brands as CMO, President, Product Manager- Helped build three global CRM brands: ACT!, SalesLogix and Infusionsoft- Helped grow two Phoenix startups to $100 million in revenues - Infusionsoft and SalesLogix (SalesLogix went public in 1999)- Involved in raising over $145 million in venture capital investment- Named 2013 Marketer of the Year by the Phoenix Business Journal and the Business Marketing Association of Phoenix- Ran a $40-$50 million software business inside a global public company for four years- Advised hundreds of founders, early stage CEOs and small business owners- Writing a book on the growth marketing strategy for entrepreneurs and founders- Contributor to the growing tech startup ecosystem in Phoenix, Arizona for over 15 years Check out Gregslist of 200+ Arizona Software Companies) http://greghead.com/gregslist-arizona-software-companies. It's the most comprehensive list of Arizona software companies of all sizes.My professional passion is helping entrepreneurs create wildly successful businesses so they can do big things, change the world and have a great life.Website and Blog - http://greghead.comTwitter - @GregHead
